attachments.title: thecedarprince - Twitch
attachments.text: My name is Jacob Zelko! My background is in biomedical engineering, biomedical informatics, and healthcare. I enjoy programming in Julia and Python. I find it even more fun with others! Welcome to the stream one and all!

Gauging interest on two new ideas for my #twitch #streams:

1. More #educational content: talking on how I learn and educational #research, how to set up learning systems, & #studying. :books:

2. Hats! Choose silly hats for me to wear during streams for fun!:tophat:

Vote and let me know!

messages.text: Thanks for your support everyone and I look forward to your thoughts on this!

elements.text: Thanks for your support everyone and I look forward to your thoughts on this!

messages.text: The second is hats! I had a lot of fun wearing my goofy santa hat for the holiday season and think it might be fun to keep the trend going! I have a few more goofy hats that I have just acquired and was thinking that may be a fun way to interact with you guys! Perhaps we could have polls or some sort of in-stream voting about what hat I should wear. Think this would be a fun idea? :tophat:

messages.text: The first is I am an independent learner and I love to study. Anywhere from papers to languages fall under the purview of my interests! As a result, I have developed quite a mature personal learning system that I have both written about here and there as well as use to study on my own. It has gotten to the point where members from other learning communities - not just the Julia one - are curious about my learning habits. I am thinking about adding this component into my streams to both reach a bigger audience, engage and educate others on learning habits I have developed (and of course to learn from others!), and also to explore this hobby of mine that I enjoy. In future streams with this component, we would still have programming and issue tracking and software development. With this new component, there just might be sessions where I focus more on learning or less depending on how I feel. What do people think of that idea?

messages.text: Hi eveyone! Streaming today on more Franklin.jl shenanigans as we continue to modify and introduce new content for the port of the So Simple theme! Afterwards, I am going to continue my studying of sorting algorithms, big oh notation, and maybe fundamental data structures such as trees time permitting! Come hang out, ask your questions, or say hey! <https://www.twitch.tv/thecedarprince>

attachments.title: thecedarprince - Twitch
attachments.text: My name is Jacob Zelko! My background is in biomedical engineering, biomedical informatics, and healthcare. I enjoy programming in Julia and Python. I find it even more fun with others! Welcome to the stream one and all!

elements.text: Hi eveyone! Streaming today on more Franklin.jl shenanigans as we continue to modify and introduce new content for the port of the So Simple theme! Afterwards, I am going to continue my studying of sorting algorithms, big oh notation, and maybe fundamental data structures such as trees time permitting! Come hang out, ask your questions, or say hey!

messages.text: Hey everyone! Streaming right now on setting up a free Franklin.jl based website on GitHub with thanks and appreciation to <@UDP5WL2RX> who ported my theme, <https://mmistakes.github.io/so-simple-theme/|So Simple>, to Franklin! We will work on porting some of my website over to deploying it from Franklin while I check for bugs with the theme! Going on from there, I'm also going to do some review of basic sorting algorithms and learn about them! Feel free to join in, hang out, and say hello! <https://www.twitch.tv/thecedarprince>

attachments.title: ANN: Announcing DoctorDocstrings.jl
attachments.text: Hello all! DoctorDocstrings.jl is a package that will help you enhance your REPL workflow for adding docstrings to your package. It is very simple, alpha, and hardcoded (for now). Dear lord don’t judge me from the janky hacks it’s awful awful. But it works! The idea is to listdocs($MyPackage) to know see all exports in your package/module and true/false for having docstrings/examples. diagnosedocs($MyPackage) if you only want to know the ones that are missing docstrings Now that you know ...

messages.text: Hey everyone! I am going to be streaming on more Javis development where I am going to work more on issues regarding bugs, learning about exporting code from different packages, and adding in some new features! Come swing by, hang out, and chat a while to keep me company! <https://www.twitch.tv/thecedarprince>

elements.text: Hey everyone! I am going to be streaming on more Javis development where I am going to work more on issues regarding bugs, learning about exporting code from different packages, and adding in some new features! Come swing by, hang out, and chat a while to keep me company!

messages.text: Streaming right now on Javis development! Getting back into the swing of things now and will start working on the next iteration of Javis! Super excited to say that thanks to the work of <@ULX78CTC3>, we will possibly be making Javis have full feature parity in Jupyter notebooks! Will be reviewing some issues and PRs today and maybe get to some blogging about projects I have been up to! Come join here: <https://www.twitch.tv/thecedarprince>
